required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate Botulinum Neurotoxin Serotype E (EB-001) in Reducing Musculoskeletal Pain in Abdominoplasty
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2 Study to Evaluate Safety and Efficacy of EB-001 Intramuscular (IM) Injections in Reducing Musculoskeletal Pain in Subjects Undergoing Elective Abdominoplasty Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: To determine the safety and efficacy of single intra-operative treatment of Botulinum Neurotoxin Serotype E (EB-001) intramuscular (IM) injections into the Rectus Abdominus (RA) in participants undergoing abdominoplasty.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve (AUC) of Participant's Assessment of Pain Using the Numerical Pain Rating Scale (NPRS) at Rest Between 12 and 96 Hours Postsurgery (AUC12-96)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Every 2 hours from 12 to 96 hours postsurgery
primary_outcome.description: The participant assessed their current pain using the 11-point NPRS where: 0=no pain to 10=worst pain imaginable. AUC was calculated using the standard trapezoidal rule.

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC of Participant's Assessment of Pain Using the NPRS at Rest Between 0 and 96 Hours Postsurgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 2 hours from 0 to 96 hours postsurgery
secondary_outcome.description: The participant assessed their current pain using the 11-point NPRS where: 0=no pain to 10=worst pain imaginable. AUC was calculated using the standard trapezoidal rule.

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC of Participant's Assessment of Pain Using the NPRS at Rest Between 0 and 72 Hours Postsurgery (AUC0-72)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 2 hours from 0 to 72 hours postsurgery
secondary_outcome.description: The participant assessed their current pain using the 11-point NPRS where: 0=no pain to 10=worst pain imaginable. AUC was calculated using the standard trapezoidal rule.

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC of Participant's Assessment of Pain Using the NPRS at Rest Between 0 and 48 Hours Postsurgery (AUC0-48)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 2 hours from 0 to 48 hours postsurgery
secondary_outcome.description: The participant assessed their current pain using the 11-point NPRS where: 0=no pain to 10=worst pain imaginable. AUC was calculated using the standard trapezoidal rule.

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC of Participant's Assessment of Pain Using the NPRS at Rest Between 0 and 24 Hours Postsurgery (AUC0-24)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 2 hours from 0 to 24 hours postsurgery
secondary_outcome.description: The participant assessed their current pain using the 11-point NPRS where: 0=no pain to 10=worst pain imaginable. AUC was calculated using the standard trapezoidal rule.

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC of Participant's Assessment of Pain Using the NPRS at Rest Between 12 and 24 Hours Postsurgery (AUC12-24)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 2 hours from 12 to 24 hours postsurgery
secondary_outcome.description: The participant assessed their current pain using the 11-point NPRS where: 0=no pain to 10=worst pain imaginable. AUC was calculated using the standard trapezoidal rule.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants Overall Assessment of Pain Using the NPRS After Discharge
secondary_outcome.description: The participant assessed their pain after discharge using the 11-point NPRS where: 0=no pain to 10=worst pain imaginable.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participant's Overall Assessment of Pain Using the NPRS-Activity (NPRS-A)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 8, 16, 24, 30, 36, 42, 48, 54, 60, 66, 72.78.84, and 96 hours after surgery; Days 8, 15 and 29 after discharge
secondary_outcome.description: The participant assessed their pain using the 11-point NPRS-A, after sitting up in the bed unassisted at an angle of approximately ≥ 45 degrees, swinging legs out, putting feet down, standing up, and walking approximately 10 feet, where: 0=no pain to 10=worst pain imaginable.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants by Patient Global Assessment (PGA) of Pain Control Score Categories
secondary_outcome.description: The participant assessed their overall pain control in the past 24 hours using the PGA 4-point scale where: 0=poor, 1=fair, 2=good and 3=excellent.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Doses of Rescue Medications Used

arm_group.description: Placebo (sterile saline solution 0.9% Sodium Chloride Injection) injected into RA muscles during abdominoplasty surgery.
Single botulinum neurotoxin serotype E Dose 1 injection into RA muscles during abdominoplasty surgery.
Single botulinum neurotoxin serotype E Dose 2 injection into RA muscles during abdominoplasty surgery.
Single botulinum neurotoxin serotype E Dose 3 injection into RA muscles during abdominoplasty surgery.

intervention.description: Single botulinum neurotoxin serotype E injection into RA muscles during abdominoplasty surgery.
Placebo (sterile saline solution 0.9% Sodium Chloride Injection) injected into RA muscles during abdominoplasty surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Men or women 23 to 55 years of age, inclusive
2. Scheduled to undergo elective abdominoplasty surgery with full length plication from xyphoid to pubis, and removal of skin/fat flap under general anesthesia (endotracheal or otherwise) without liposuction
3. American Society of Anesthesiologist (ASA) Physical Class 1-2.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. History of prior major abdominal surgery as judged by the investigator
2. Pre-existing lung disease that could impact participant safety in the opinion of the investigator
3. Pre-existing disorders of the neuromuscular junction (myasthenia gravis, Eaton- Lambert syndrome, or amyotrophic lateral Sclerosis)
4. At high risk of deep vein thrombosis as judged by the investigators determined by a Caprini score of 3 or higher
5. Slow vital capacity that is below 80% of normal value for respective race, age, height, and gender or below 2.5 Liters (L) of absolute volume
6. Pulse oximetry below 95%
7. Body weight less than 50 kg (110 pounds) or a Body Mass Index (BMI) of ≥ 32
8. Reported use of any botulinum toxin within 3 months prior to the date of surgery
9. Use of long acting opioids within 3 days or any opioid medication within 24 hours prior to surgery
10. Aminoglycoside intake within 48 hours prior to or during surgery
11. Participants on anti-depressant or anti-psychotic medications
12. Reported pain score of 2 or more at screening on the 11-point scale numerical pain rating scale-administered after an activity (NPRS-A) following an activity after and walking approximately 10 feet.

group.description: Placebo (sterile saline solution 0.9% Sodium Chloride Injection) injected into rectus abdominus (RA) muscles during abdominoplasty surgery.

outcome.title: Area Under the Curve (AUC) of Participant's Assessment of Pain Using the Numerical Pain Rating Scale (NPRS) at Rest Between 12 and 96 Hours Postsurgery (AUC12-96)
outcome.description: The participant assessed their current pain using the 11-point NPRS where: 0=no pain to 10=worst pain imaginable. AUC was calculated using the standard trapezoidal rule.
outcome.time_frame: Every 2 hours from 12 to 96 hours postsurgery
outcome.population: Modified Intent-to-treat (mITT) population included all randomized and treated participants with at least one post-injection pain score.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
